page.title: 16SICKNESS AND HEALTH
page.content: Lismore is a{caring community}and has among its women{12 State Registered {Nurses}and three more with some nursing training. The{Health Servce}provides for{one full-time{District Nurse}with a{relief {nurse}for week ends and holidays, and another for occasional work. The{elderly}and{chronic sick}may have {daily visits.}There is{one Home Help. There is no doctor lving on the island and no Health Centre. We have a {young doctor}who comes by ferry boat from{Appin}on Mondays to be consulted in the island's{cold Hall.}On Thursdays he{visits}people n their{own {homes. The{doctor}will come over on other days or at{night,}and an{ambulance}can come by{boat}from{Oban}to take someone to{hospital _}in{Oban}or{Glasgow. There is also a{helicopter service.
